rename.from: Main branch fails to compile on Rust beta.
rename.to: Main branch fails to compile on Rust beta: new dead code warnings

body: These are generally expected to be dead: use an `expect` statement to silence them, while explaining why this code exists.
Hi, is anyone already working on this? If not, Iâ€™d like to pick it up.

```text
failures:

---- tests::reflect_type_info stdout ----

thread 'tests::reflect_type_info' (3551445) panicked at crates/bevy_reflect/src/lib.rs:2305:9:
assertion `left == right` failed
  left: "alloc::borrow::Cow<'_, str>"
 right: "alloc::borrow::Cow<str>"


failures:
    tests::reflect_type_info

test result: FAILED. 263 passed; 1 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.01s

error: test failed, to rerun pass `-p bevy_reflect --lib`
```
I get this additionally on nightly, which is a very strange failure

issue.title: (stable) CI Fix

labels.name: C-Code-Quality

labels.name: S-Ready-For-Final-Review

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective
fixes #20748

## Solution
add `dead_code` to a bunch of test and example structs.

## Testing

`cargo run -p ci` works on beta (but not nightly)
There's a handful of `unfulfilled_lint_expectations` on these `dead_code`s that I'm not sure how to suppress in some compilation runs but not in others.
